intro: Viola kashmiriana, commonly known as the Kashmir violet, is a herbaceous perennial native to the high-altitude regions of the Kashmir region in India. It features heart-shaped, velvety leaves and produces delicate, showy flowers in shades of purple and white. The plant typically blooms in early spring and is adapted to cool, moist environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and rocky soils at elevations above 2,500 meters. Viola kashmiriana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
